body.name: Style N Craft Work Belt, Durable and Rugged Belt

byLineInfo.name: Visit the Style N Craft Store

deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 4 hrs 10 mins
features: Innovative Work Belt: Made with heavy full-grain leather, the Style n Craft work belt is stylish and durable. The work belt features stitching with matching color heavy-duty nylon thread, which gives the belt a trendy and unique look

Sturdy Construction: An ideal belt for all workers, this work belt is 2" wide and well-built with heavy-duty stitching and rivets for extra strength, longevity, and durability. This belt does not sag, ensures mobility, and provides bending comfort

Amazingly Compatible: Our belt is perfect for carrying tool pouches, accessories, and framer's pouches for heavy workloads. Sleek and stylish, this belt can also be used to spruce up any casual outfit

Adjustable Work Belt: The ergonomic and unique construction of the leather work belt makes it easy to adjust during long working sessions. The belt comes in one size and can easily fit a waist size of 30" - 46" (measure waist size over clothes)

Stylish Work Belt: Available in black color, the work belt features a robust double-pronged metal roller buckle and capped rivets for safety. All its metal hardware has a nickel finish for a premium appearance

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About the Brand Style N Craft - The brand for High Quality Work Gear and Leather Bags & Accessories. The work gear collection comprises of Tool Bags, Tool Belts, Tool Pouches, Tool Organizers, Tool Holders, Safety Workwear Products & Work Belts. The leather goods collection showcases Wallets, Clutch Wallets, Messenger Bags, Crossbody Bags, Backpacks, Duffle Bags & Belts in leather. 2" Wide Work Belt In Full-Grain Leather Now design your own tool belt as per your needs with our 2" wide work belt. The belt features stitching with matching color heavy-duty nylon thread and is ideal for all workers. The ergonomic construction of the belt ensures it does not sag or restrict mobility. The belt comes in one size and can easily fit a waist size of 30"–46" (measure waist size over clothes). The belt has capped rivets for safety. Made with 100% full-grain leather Color - Black Matching color heavy-duty nylon thread stitching Robust and road-ready for every situation Double-pronged metal roller buckle Nickel finish on all metal hardware

The belt is 2" wide with a double-prong metal roller buckle and has rivets with caps for more safety. The belt features stitching with matching color heavy-duty nylon thread and is road-ready for every harsh situation. This leather tool belt is ideal for everyone and can easily fit a waist measuring 30"–46" (waist size to be measured over the clothes).

Style n Craft 2" Wide Full-Grain Leather Work Belt (#392752) Style n Craft 2" Wide Full-Grain Oiled Leather Work Belt (#74052) Style n Craft 3" Wide, Long, Tapered Full-Grain Oiled Leather Work Belt (#74055) Style n Craft 2" Wide Extra Long Full-Grain Oiled Leather Work Belt (74053) Style n Craft 1-1/2" Wide Full-Grain Leather Work Belt (#98051) Material Full-Grain Leather Full-Grain Oiled Leather Full-Grain Oiled Leather Full-Grain Leather Full-Grain Leather Waist Size (to be measured over clothes) 30"–46" 32"–46" 42"–54" 30"–46" 32"–46" Color Black Dark Brown Dark Brown Black Dark Tan

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the second time I've bought this belt. The first time was in 2015. That's right 8 years ago. One of the belt holes was ripped open and the belt was slightly stretched. By far the best belt I've ever owned! 8 years! Awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Leather
reviews.reviewText: The belt is high quality. I expect it will last many years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A BONAFIDE WORK BELT!!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great item if you are a fellow sufferer of the disease "Noassatallis"I have tried probably 20 other belts including the ones with elastic sewn in trying to keep my pants up in the various bends of my work through the day.Most days I show more butt than a plumber and slightly less than a pole dancer.After receiving a nasty derriere sunburn I began to look for a belt made to actually be a belt and not a fashion accessory.The fact I often carry tools and essentials for the job in my cargo pockets, just complicates the problem more. After looking through dozens of sites, this is the beefiest one I could find.This is a very manly belt, for work no murse packers or yuppies need to apply.This is heavy thick oiled course cut cowhide, solid brass hardware with welded loop (not bent wire), and quad riveted together. This thing will last a long time, and has gotten to be very comfortable with break in to be so thick, yet it holds my pants up with all my work essentials (wrenches pliers ratchets etc) crammed in the thigh pockets.The only drawback is most pants dont have 2" belt loops,and with the thickness of the strap it just wont fit.This was an easy fix though.I cut 5/16" off the full width and know I can even wear it with my jeans.Great product good price point, great service, and a must have for the working man.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing is BIG (IWB)
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for an IWB carry belt that didn't buckle or lose shape when carrying my xD or G23. This thing is super great, and so much cheaper than belts advertised for IWB. There are a couple of problems- the belt is lether but not polished leather, the back of it has an unfinished feel to it. If it gets wet, I'm assuming your pants could get stained. The biggest issue is that this thing is HUGE. I guess I didn't know what 2" meant, but, this takes up all of the loop and flat out won't fit in some pants. I haven't had a problem with my jeans, but, you can't wear this belt with dress pants. That's the biggest limitation. For the price, it's unbeatable. Your tool doesn't move, it feels super secure. The belt is lightweight and distributes the load over a huge surface area, thus- no give. It's awesome. I bought two, and if I needed more, I'd buy them in a heartbeat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2011
reviews.reviewText: It is, indeed, a sad commentary when one feels compelled to praise a manufacturer and/or vendor for that which was once taken for granted as commonplace, yet such is the case. The belt--in all of its simplicity--is well made; will, I believe, last for decades; and, in truth, exceeds my expectations. A work belt, however, it fits the loops on my jeans and is far more comfortable than the narrow belts which have long been in vogue. I was impressed to the point that I placed a followup order for additional belts. If there exist any negatives, I have yet to discover them. In summary, it is wide, it is comfortable, functional, and practical. it is a simple, plain, and,to me, an attractive belt that I would not hesitate to recommend. Finally, I commend Amazon for their fast delivery and professional service throughout this transaction.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome belt, and priced well
reviews.reviewText: This belt is well made. Heavy duty leather. I cannot imagine it ever wearing out or falling apart..I wear a 30" pant, and Im able to cinch this belt down with holes to spare. I think this belt could work for anyone 28" and up. I trimmed about 9 inches off mine, and it is about the perfect size for me. It is basically just a flat strap of leather with holes punched in it, so trimming it doesn't require more than a good, sharp knife. I got it primarily to use as a belt to support a revolver and cantine when I go out into the wilderness. It supports that weight just fine. The wide belt distributes the weight evenly, rather than digging in and sagging like a narrow/thin belt. I don't think you could find a better belt for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It Is Fair
reviews.reviewText: All the available holes mean that the waist size is very adjustable. I have checked to see very closely if the belt color or dye "bleeds" onto pants or shirts. So far, it hasn't. Belt is nice and thick. Perfect at 2" wide for utility pants and jeans since most of them have wide belt loops. Won't work on dress or casual pants since most of them are around 1.5" to 1.75". With this belt it stops the waist from rolling or curling over. The finish isn't great, nothing fancy. The buckle is pretty cheap looking as well. My complaint with this and a lot of other belt brands is that they rivet or tack weld the end of the belt onto the belt buckle and loop. You can't make any adjustments or change out the buckle unless you use a mini saw and pry tool. The loop is too close to the buckle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars good quality and takes abuse
reviews.reviewText: I wear it with my Carhardt work pants/shorts depending on the season. My job is outside and very physical so I sweat a fair amount. Getting any leather wet eventually destroys it. I buy a new one every year or so. I am very pleased at how it stands up to the abuse.
I bought this for my work tool belt and it is Just what I needed. The belt is thick And can carry a load.
2 inch wide is not so common and this is a tough good looking belt

Very happy with this purchase I go through belts like crazy so I have tried a lot of brands, but this belt is the best I have come across. Sturdy saddle quality leather to stand the test of time, and a simple but solid brass buckle that can take a beating.I wear carhartt and dickies work pants and the belt is a nice snug fit in the loops, it also fits jeans really well.If I had to complain about anything, it would be that the belt loop could be moved about an inch or so away from the buckle.Still a definite 5 star belt in my eyes.I would definitely purchase this belt again, although I dont think I will ever have to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 6, 2019
